sentences.en: a country with few mineral resources
sentences.cn: 矿产资源稀少的国家

sentences.en: A glass of mineral water, please.
sentences.cn: 请给我来杯矿泉水。

sentences.en: Among the mineral deposits of the province , tin occupies first place ; copper comes second.
sentences.cn: 该省矿藏, 以锡最多, 铜次之.

sentences.en: Drink at least 2 litres of still mineral water throughout the day to aid detoxification.
sentences.cn: 每天至少饮用2升无气矿泉水以帮助身体解毒。

sentences.en: He insisted that the mineral content of the water determined the opacity.
sentences.cn: 他坚持认为水的清澈程度取决于其中矿物质的含量。

sentences.en: If oil or gold are discovered under your lot, you can sell the mineral rights.
sentences.cn: 如果在你这块地底下发现了石油或金子，你可以把采矿权卖掉。

sentences.en: In all production practice and research at present, quartz is the main gangue mineral in hematite ore and the flotation target.
sentences.cn: 在目前所有的生产实践和研究工作当中，石英是赤铁矿矿石中主要的脉石矿物和浮选对象。

sentences.en: In course of sinking the well - shaft they came upon a deposit of a very rare mineral.
sentences.cn: 他们在凿井的过程中,发现了一处稀有矿物矿床.

sentences.en: It would be wise to include plenty of mineral rich foods in your diet.
sentences.cn: 多吃富含矿物质的食物有益身体。

sentences.en: mineral water
sentences.cn: 矿泉水

sentences.en: Or they could be trained to use weeds as indicators of the soil's mineral properties to help them manage nutrients.
sentences.cn: 或者可以训练他们使用杂草作为土壤矿物属性的指示器，从而帮助他们管理营养物质。

sentences.en: She bent down and picked up a mineral.
sentences.cn: 她弯下身子捡起一块矿石.

sentences.en: The area is very rich in minerals .
sentences.cn: 该地区矿产非常丰富。

sentences.en: The body is made of mineral-reinforced thermo-plastic.
sentences.cn: 主体材料是矿物增强热塑性塑料。

sentences.en: The mineral is weakly magnetic.
sentences.cn: 这种矿物带有轻微的磁性。

sentences.en: The rock is rich in mineral salts.
sentences.cn: 该岩石中富含矿盐。

sentences.en: There are rich mineral deposits in this region.
sentences.cn: 这一带地下埋藏着丰富的矿产.

sentences.en: They question all plant and mineral witnesses.
sentences.cn: 他们质问所有的閰植物和矿物证人。

sentences.en: This precious mineral is found in many provinces.
sentences.cn: 许多省都有这种珍贵矿物.

sentences.en: Valuable mineral deposits have been found in this region.
sentences.cn: 在这地区发现有价值的矿床.

sentences.en: When these surfaces came into contact with the magnetite, an oxygen atom could be transferred from quartz to magnetite, forming a new mineral, hematite.
sentences.cn: 当这些表面和磁铁矿一接触，氧原子就能从石英砂转移到磁铁矿，形成了一种新的矿物，赤铁矿。

sentences.en: Zemel says that when calcium levels are low, the body releases a hormone that helps squeeze the most out of every available milligram of the mineral.
sentences.cn: 泽莫尔博士说,当人体中的钙含量偏低时, 身体里就会产生一种荷尔蒙,它能帮助肌体最大限度地吸收所摄入的钙.

words.tran_cn: 矿，矿藏；矿山，矿井；地雷，水雷
使成矿（mineralize的过去式和过去分词）
使含无机化合物；使矿物化
[矿物]矿物；（英）矿泉水；无机物；苏打水（常用复数表示）

phrases.tran_cn: 知矿物；主成份矿物；基本矿物
矿物晶体，无机晶体；天然水晶
矿藏；矿储藏量；矿产储藏

trans.tran_en: of or containing or derived from minerals
a substance that is formed naturally in the earth, such as coal, salt, stone, or gold. Minerals can be dug out of the ground and used
